intro: Minuartia recurva var. juressi, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh conditions, with succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It often grows on limestone or sandstone surfaces, thriving in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
